meanings.definition: Uncertainty or anxiety about oneself or one's abilities.
meanings.sent1: Her insecurity made her doubt her own skills.
meanings.sent2: His insecurity often holds him back from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The cat's insecurity about the vacuum cleaner was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fortress's insecurity against the enemy's attack was evident.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave only heightened the explorer's insecurity.

meanings.sent1: The student's insecurity prevented him from speaking up in class.
meanings.sent2: Her insecurity about her appearance affected her self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: The tree's insecurity about its height was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The boat's insecurity in the stormy sea was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind only added to the sailor's insecurity about the voyage.

meanings.definition: Vulnerability or susceptibility to harm or danger.
meanings.sent1: The child's insecurity in the dark room was evident.
meanings.sent2: His insecurity about the icy road made him drive cautiously.
meanings.sent3: The flower's insecurity about the strong wind was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge's insecurity under the weight of the truck was concerning.
meanings.sent5: The hiker's insecurity about the steep cliff made him hesitate.
